author: Michael Solomon
title: Free WIFI For Minibus Taxis
description:
There is next to zero awareness of Cardano in South Africa.

The cost of Mobile data in South Africa is amongst the highest in the world.

assessments.note: its not really clear how the routers have anything to do with Cardano. This seems to just be a request for funds to start a small retail store to sell some Cardano related hardware.

The proposal is very positive for the inhabitants of South Africa, because, according to the data provided, this project could help to overcome this lack of access to the internet. In terms of novelty and adequacy requirements, the proposal is very creative and uses pre-existing means to exercise your idea, which is a very positive point. However, the author did not specify how he would give the project's feedback to the Cardano community, which would also be interesting.

The proposal has some great ideas to incentivize participation with Cardano in Africa through free wifi systems and brick and mortar outreach. If properly realized this falls squarely within the challenge.

The idea of providing free WiFi in cabs with a caveat that the user will go through a Cardano advertising app might be a workable solution. The cost for running this enterprise is proposed to be subsidized by running a "fun with electronics" shop. The idea is workable and can improve the awareness and utilization of Cardano.

it is very difficult to understand what the proposer is actually proposing. There is the shop for Cardano Open Source Store. In the comment it is mentioned, that the requested fund is for this store. The proposal does state, that the funds are for wifi for minibus taxis. And also something about nfts for art is mentioned. Each of these aspects may provide some value but it not clear what this proposal is specifically about

This proposal has wifi in mini bus taxis as the title but the proposal includes information about NFTs and grade 7 robotics without making clear what the connection to the wifi project is. The routers concept does seem to address the challenge of growing Cardano in Africa but the details of how are very unclear in the writing. The proposal does not tell us key metrics and goals nor how they will scale to address future challenges. I do like the idea but cannot award higher points due to lack of detailed plan.

It is not clear what the plan actually is? If it is the routers for mini buses why do we need a store. It seems the proposers has a few ideas, but that they don't necessarily require each other. Perhaps focus on one.

The author of the proposal is well prepared to execute it, due to his years of experience with the areas that involve the idea, such as the automobile and Graphic Design. The use of Information and Graphic Design is of crucial importance in the transfer of information, in a clear and intuitive way. Regarding the participation of Africans, it would happen, for example, in the stages of installing routers, such as drivers, etc., so it is quite significant.

The proposal is wordy and lacks focus. The initial free wifi idea evolves into something totally different so it seems like two proposals in one. They also note a launch date 4-6 weeks after funding, which seems unrealistic.  I think the team needs to spend more time refining their ideas before they will appear feasible.

The proposer claims to have sufficient experiance and seems to be associated with WADA. However it is not clearly emerging from the proposal. The project requires a ground presence on a continuous basis and has huge implementation risk. The identity and motivation of the implementor will decide the outcome of the proposal.

the problem that it is not clear what specifically is to be implemented also affects this evaluation criterion. The qualifications listed are not very detailed. However, some of the listed objectives of the proposal do not require a particularly high level of expertise, and from the description of the projects in the proposal, it can be seen that the proposer has already dealt with the problem in more detail and therefore has at least basic expertise in this area. I score neutral.

There is a massive potential for Cardano in South Africa, but this proposal needs further development in terms of feasibility. This proposal lack details on proposer's team experience, team skills, and Project plan

There is a budget outlined. The proposer states that the project could be profitable within 6 months but there is no rational, break-even analysis or evidence for us to verify the claim. It is unclear what the risks are for starting this business in South Africa (are there bureaucratic or business challenges to be aware of? why does the project need to open a brick and mortar shop?). The timetable provided is vague: only 4-6 weeks and 6 months offered within the writing.

The author describes in detail how access to the internet would be given, through an application with which it would be possible to establish the connection when riding in vehicles. He also explains what the application would be like, its content and the languages available. The proposal details the cost of each stage of the project's implementation: the cost of objects such as the router, services with installation, marketing ... It also considers the large circulation of minibuses as an existing factor, so the author took into account consideration the implementation part already during the elaboration of the idea. However, there is a shortage in relation to the description of the people involved and deadlines to be met (I identified some information about it, but little). Including more details about the actions of the project, just as it was detailed very well about the costs, would be beneficial.

funds are allocated to certain purposes, the timeframe and costs are vague. Launch is expected in 6 weeks, but the physical location is rented for 6 months. The cost of routers and 4g service do not appear to be included in this breakdown.  I suggest the proposers work on a more focused and limited proposal/proposals in future rounds. Small pilots and proofs of concepts will go a long way to securing more funding for expansion in future rounds.

The success of the proposal is implicit. The implementation is auditable by monitoring how many taxies are fitted with the Cardano router and the progress in establishing the shop. However, it isn't easy to establish clearly whether the initiative is successful. Sucess of the shop may or may not indicate impetus to the adaptation of Cardano in the region.

There is a basic breakdown of costs but no definition of success or possible KPIs that can be applied. For each of the listed projects it would be relatively easy to find corresponding milestones or KPIs. e.g.: Number of minibuses equipped with wifi. Prototype for Cardano Connect app created etc. If the propsal does not clearly specify which aspects are to be tracked exactly, this is also a big problem for checking the achievement of the objectives.

This proposal lack a roadmap therefore making the project hard to audit for progress. Please develop a step by step action plan.  When you receive fund what will be your first step? and after 3, 6, or 12 month where will the project be?  When will this proposal be completed?
The proposal lacks a detailed roadmap and key metrics that would provide auditability. We have no way of knowing if the project is successful based on information given.

solution: Fit Minibus taxis with a 4g router with shared folder for offline content this will provide the foundation for marketing and tokenization.
experience:
40 years work experience in South Africa

15 years in the motor industry

15 years marketing, Graphic design, Event Planning & Coordination
